course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Quantitative Methods in the Social Sciences
course.description: Introduction to quantitative methods used across social science disciplines. The course covers basic statistical inference, the linear regression model, and regression analysis in practice, with a focus on the use of quantitative methods to address social science theories. Students who do not have the pre-requisites may enroll in the course with approval by the instructor.
course.prerequisites: ISOM 2500 or MATH 2411 or SOSC 1100
course.exclusions: ECON 3334, MATH 3424, MATH 4424, MGCS 5010, MGCS 5011, SSMA 5020
